instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V8_SLPS2R: What is PP1V8_SLPS2R? PP1V8_SLPS2R is a 1.8v power rail present when the system is in a SLPS2R state. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: this board had a food spill and was thoroughly cleaned. the amp meter reads 5v 0.000a.  i haven't found any shorted caps but  did find a missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all small coils around <CHIP>U7800</CHIP>; compare with good board, if possible.
T2 requires all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages to start working.
What about actual <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>?

threads.message: i get no continuity on L7813 or L7815. the others have continuity

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I expected to get some readings...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I lifted the two coils and they were visibly broken.  the metal was still left on the padding. i've replaced them and now it's  20v on the amp meter and the ampage keeps cycling from 1.03a and back down to 0.   ppbus keeps cycling from 12.68 to 10v but that's because the battery is charging slowly. when pressing the power button, the backlight on the display stays on even though there is no cpu vcore

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Is the machine recognized in DFU mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: i tried to put it into dfu mode but it might have a bad keyboard

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Force it in DFU with SE032...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: it goes into dfu mode with the keyboard method. It gives the "waiting" error message.  why would those two coils be broken like that? that area was closed in with a medal shield that i had to remove

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
No idea.

I recommend to test with known good battery and original 87W charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: i'm using a 87w apple charger and the battery is charging so it must be good.  i'm checking the coils around the pmic.  <SIGNAL>PP1V_PRIM</SIGNAL>  is 0v and <SIGNAL>PPVPCORE_S5</SIGNAL> is 0v.  should they show up now or later?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Did you try revive, or restore?
SSD voltages come on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: i've tried revive and restore. which voltages are for the ssd?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Take a look at page 81.
Also check G3S voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: all the nand and g3s voltages are there but it still goes to 20v  and 0.000a without battery and with battery it tries to charge and then resets. It looks like some of the solder balls under the t2 are combined from the spill

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>   missing <SIGNAL>PP1V8_SLPS2R</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Mentioned broken coils may point to some T2 damage...
